reviews.review_msg: Great
Great professer. Sometimes he use textbook sometimes not. But overall great. Very easy

Michael is a great prof who is passionate about what he is speaking about. Lectures were not boring and super engaging. He did his best to make assignments fun and not just a regular research paper. Weekly readings were actually nice to read and not boring. He did a great job of making the course entertaining.

Mike is the BEST. Lectures were engaging and the assigned readings were fantastic (I actually wanted to read them)! Super caring/understanding and wants his students to succeed. He made political theory super interesting and incorporated pop culture in assignments, which were really fun and not typical/boring. Couldn't recommend more!!

The TA's  are the only downfall. So unapproachable and give very little feedback. Midterm/final was rather difficult only due to the fact that the essay questions are worth half of the exam marks and you really have to know the content to get full marks on them. otherwise he's a good prof.

Laurence is really funny and chill during lectures, he makes funny jokes. The material is very boring but he makes it fun and I never used the textbook unless it was for the assignments. He also ran my tutorials which was nice when you have questions. The mid term and exam was moderate, he does give hints about what is going to be on them.

easy class with fair exams, don't but a textbook cause you will never use it. If you study the slides you will be good to go and pass the class with flying colours. Only downside was the TAs marking was very inconsistant and your grade on papers fully depended on which TA marked it

Great prof! Lectures are always lighthearted and not droning. Marking was inconsistent, because the TAs switch papers so your TA may not mark your assignment. Midterm and final are reasonable difficulty, nothing too bad. Course readings were boring but not test material, only lectures and slides. He's nice during office hours, and will help with hw
Great prof! Took his POL 151 class and just now finishing up the term. I highly recommend him; great lectures and is very approachable and gives thoughtful responses!

Laurence is a very funny guy. he cracks jokes related to lecture material which truthfully helped me retain the knowledge. He is very helpful and understanding of student situations. His lectures are very helpful and he directly covers any materials he will be quizzing you on. textbook is not required but did help in some instances
Amazing prof, the courses are ok but he makes them interesting. Incredible helpful and a great guy to talk to. Some papers but clear outlines and a good marker. Very highly recommend him
A fantastic and inspirational professor at SFU. His course was equally fantastic and very interesting. I would highly recommend anyone to take a course with Michael.

Mike is a tremendous professor and a case study on how to treat your students with kindness, respect, and humility. In all my interactions with him, I always felt like I was talking to someone who cared about my success in the course. Put simply, he is a must-take for any student, and will be the standard you evaluate your future profs against.
A very funny prof, he provides lots of support and has tons of enthusiasm. I would recommend him for any course in POL. Exams and assignments are very straightforward, there are no surprises.
amazing prof and his TA richard was class too

Every student at SFU needs to take a class with Mike. He is hilarious and can turn any boring subject into something interesting. Not only is Mike funny, but he is incredibly knowledgeable and happy to answer questions from his students.

Mike is a super nice guy. Although I never met him because the class was online, he came across really caring and compassionate in his emails. He is very interested in the class material as demonstrated in his lectures which was great for anyone but especially me, a first year student.

I've taken classes with Mike twice now, and he is a GEM. Literally one of the most genuinely funny and kind profs at SFU, especially in political science. I plan on taking every class I can get with him. He is lenient with extensions and released our final one day early for extra time, and marks very fair. Overall, you'll love him.
One of the best profs I had

I have said this multiple times, Mike is the best thing at the department of politics sci in SFU. I took 7 classes with him and would take even more if I hadn't graduated. Amazing prof, a must try at SFU!

Mike is passionate about the topics he teaches, and he genuinely cares about his students' learning. There are other profs in the dept who clearly prioritize their own research and see teaching as a side gig that they have to do, but Mike is the exact opposite. He puts our learning first and foremost and puts a lot of effort and creativity into it!

Mike is awesome! Absolutely amazing. The course contained so many interesting readings and discussions. Hes a pretty chill guy and a super fair marker. Dont understand why he doesnt have a higher rating. Take him if you can!

Micheal might be the best poli sci prof at SFU. Straightforward, approachable, and super knowledgeable, he makes every lecture interesting not by talking at you, but by prompting engaging discussions. Only 2-3 large assignments, so a lot of weight is put on participation. If you're looking for a good corona class, this is it! Mike is your guy.

You could tell that the whole class really respected Mike, and it's easy to see why. He is so knowledgeable and leads really interesting discussions. Assignments weren't too bad. Just two papers and a presentation. Participation is key to getting a good mark as he values your input.

His intro class is what inspired me to pursue Political Science as my major. Although his lectures may sometimes be word for word, you can tell he truly cares about what he's teaching and if his students understand the material rather than pushing out loads of content. If he's teaching ANY class, TAKE HIM. Make sure you read his slides for tests!

Michael is funny, laid-back, smart, and just a great guy to sit down and talk with. He's always available for a chat during office hours and treats everyone with respect. The course is not easy but put in the effort and you'll do fine.

Super funny prof who makes lectures really interesting. Includes all information on lecture slides and is very clear with grading criteria. A lot of his assignments are more based on your personal opinion than facts/research/memorization. Would definitely take him again!

This guy is a legend. Makes boring topics interesting and will make you laugh every single class. He is also very understanding and constantly asked students how they are feeling about course material and what he can do to improve

He is an amazing professor who is very knowledgeable and is open to listening to the opinions of others, and dive into a deeper discussion about them. Makes learning about the theorists quite entertaining and is a super nice and understanding dude... would definitely take another class with Mike!

I love Michael! He makes it a real joy to go to class; you really feel like you learn something every class. He's an interesting guy, I wish I could take more classes with him! I don't normally submit reviews on RateMyProf, but felt the need to for Michael bc he deserves a good review!! You won't regret a class with him :)
Michael should teach Gender studies not Politics.
The class is too biased and is not focused on Political Science........
Horrible class.
The theorists were not political theorists, they were more on social constructionism.

Ive taken 3 classes with Mike so far and enjoyed them all. he's one of the most unbiased and fair profs ive had at SFU. All ideas and points are welcome. We read in this class theorists on the left and right. Hes very open. In this class we focused on democracy.
FUn class well more fun than I expected theory to be .. I like a lot how movies are used to explain ideas , like hobbes . also mike is very caring and excellent prof.

Judging by all the misspellings and false course codes and details listed below, this seems to be one bitter and vindictive little individual trying to tank Mike's rating. Clearly someone thought they deserved to do better than they actually did in a class. Nobody cares about your redundant and poorly expressed thoughts. Have fun.
I think Michael forgot to realize that he is teaching Political Science, not Gender Identity.
Great course fair grading

Professor Lawrence doesn't use a textbook in the class. The readings are all posted on Canvas. You don't have to buy anything. And the thinkers covered are: Marx, Nietzsche, Wollstonecraft, Rousseau, Locke, Plato, Hobbes.... pretty standard. The two bad reviews of the class are obviously fake and by someone who never actually took the class.

Not sure what this other person below is talking about. The theorists used in the course were nearly identical to those used in the course in the past. Plato, Aristotle, Locke, Machiavelli and all those guys,,, the course and instructor were awesome. Mike made theory relevant and exciting! No textbook so you save money too.

The person who gave the poor rating to 416, I don't think they were even in the class. Lecture heavy? I was in the class. The whole class was basically run by students and discussion based. This person must just be bitter about doing poorly in another class and getting a bad grade. 416 was a great class! WIsh I could take it again!
The class was boring but nice teacher
The thinkers in the course were not consistent with the theories being usually taught in this course.
The course was not bad, but, the theories was not consistent with Political Science?
The class lecture was okay
My favourite professor at SFU -- I have also taken POL310 and POL325 with him. Definitely take a class with him.

I would highly recommend this professor to anyone. He understands theory and how to lecture it to his students. Very generous with marking and wants everyone to excel in life. He also encourages class discussions. If anyone hasn't taken him, then take him before you graduate.

super passionate about the course content. readings were so interesting but sometimes long (all online, no fee). fair marker but doesn't really give you feedback on your papers/exams unless you ask. 1st half of lec was usually summarizing the readings/going over assignment expectations, 2nd half usually watching a movie/doc. chill guy overall
He genuinely cares about the content of the course. He's a very wholesome prof that wants to make lectures enjoyable while also connecting it to recent political events.

Awesome guy. I didn't find the material all that exciting but he found a way to make it bearable. if you do the readings and put some effort and go to lectures im sure you can do great! it's too late for me, wish id put more effort but its not his fault haha.
Honestly my favourite professor at SFU. Interesting courses and assignments. Allows for extra time on assignments if needed and is just genuinely a great guy.
Michael is really knowledgeable and clear in his teaching. He is also really nice, would take him again in a flash.
I learned so much from this professor. He's really fair with marking and encourages class discussion. I'm glad I have him.
Cool guy
If you just come to class you'll do spectacular!!!!!

The best professor in the world. He is very generous with the marking, he cares deeply about his students, loves teaching history also, and is a very caring person. The best professor in the Poli Sci department. They love him!!!! If you take him, you'll never regret it 100%.
This Professor is the best in the department no questions. Michael also has a caring personality, you can speak to him about anything. Highly recommended him.
